full_summary:
# Tender Announcement
## Service Contract for Black & Grey Water Flush Services

The Department of National Defence invites bids for a Service Contract to provide Black & Grey Water Flush Services onboard His/Her Majesty's Canadian Ships (HMCS). The procurement is managed by Public Works and Government Services Canada, and the work will be performed in accordance with specifications assigned to each specific call-up.

### Key Details

* **Procurement Reference**: PW-HAL-512-11568
* **Closing Date**: 2022-09-22T13:00:00
* **Duration**: One year, with three option periods of one-year duration

### Description

The contract is for the provision of services, labour, tools, equipment, and materials necessary to perform Blackwater System Flushes onboard HMCS. Bidders are expected to maintain the highest level of professionalism and adhere to all relevant regulations and standards. Tenders must be submitted in either English or French.

### Important Notes

* Security clearances are required, and bidders are responsible for obtaining these clearances prior to the issuance of the contract.
* The duration of the contract is for one year, with three option periods of one-year duration.
* A single contract will be issued.

### Request for Standing Offer

All inquiries should be submitted in writing to the Standing Offer Authority, Dale Wadden, at Dale.Wadden@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca no later than five (5) calendar days before the closing date.

### Bid Submission

The tender submission deadline is 2022-09-22T13:00:00. Bids should be submitted in accordance with the specifications outlined in the solicitation package, available on [Canada Buys website](https://canadabuys.canada.ca).

### Security Clearance

Security clearances are required for this contract. Bidders are responsible for obtaining the necessary clearances prior to contract issuance. The time required to obtain security clearance levels may be lengthy and is contingent upon the specific clearances levels required.

### Contract Duration

The contract duration is for one year, with three option periods of one-year duration.

### General Terms and Conditions

The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. The contract is governed by the laws of Canada.
